comment_text:
I think it's important everyone knows the names of what type of Fractions you're giving them so this is what it means:

Greater > or Less Than < 1 means the Numerator (Top Number) is Greater or Less Than the 1 whole shape divided into several pieces, indicated by the Denominator (Bottom Number).

Fractions where the Numerator (Top Number) is bigger than the Denominator (Bottom Number) they're called Improper Fractions.

Fractions where the Numerator (Top Number) is smaller than the Denominator (Bottom Number) they're called Proper Fractions.
You are making me do better thank you 😊
